summary: We’ve all had our share of shit before we all met. Now we’re together, we’re a family. This is better. That’s how I smile: it’s...
text: We’ve all had our share of shit before we all met. Now we’re together, we’re a family. This is better. That’s how I smile: it’s better than it was before. That’s it.
source:
Scanlan Shorthalt

Vax: We’re probably all going to die in the next month.

Scanlan: Yes, but it’s fun while it lasts.

summary: What I find interesting about Caleb’s alignment shift is that, usually by rules as written, you have to change alignment in...
body:
What I find interesting about Caleb’s alignment shift is that, usually by rules as written, you have to change alignment in terms of “steps”. So he couldn’t actually have gone directly from Lawful Evil to True Neutral.

I wonder if he hit Lawful Neutral or Neutral Evil along the way before getting to where he is now.

(Also, True Neutral is a huge step forward for him considering that and considering his past, True Neutral characters are absolutely capable of being good and kind people, so I really do hope he continues on in this trend of slowly, painstakingly dragging himself into being a better person by hook or by crook.)

summary: You know what's got me fucked up today?
body:
You know what’s got me fucked up today?

If Scanlan had used his Wish to undo Vax’s deal, would that had killed Vex instead? The deal was Vax’s soul for Vex’s. If they’d broken the deal, the Raven Queen would have no reason to uphold her end. If Wish had been casted, they could have kept Vax, but they probably would have lost Vex.

summary: So I've been catching up on CR season 2
body:
So I’ve been catching up on CR season 2

And I have some thoughts

1. Is Nott a mom? In terms of her age, Sam only said she was of “child bearing age”. Also, she refers to Caleb as “her boy” and she is clearly sending money to someone, including that baby bottle

2. Beau will like ‘check’ her observations or ideas with one of the others before bringing it up to the group. So even though she seems physically confident, she is unsure of her ability to solve problems mentally even though she does have good insights.

3. Jester seems to have childish and romanticized views on relationships and sex. Like with her dick drawings and her 'Oskar’ moments. Which makes me think she considers them as play rather than real things to partake in.


I’m only on episode 18 or so, so I may be ignorant and wrong. But I love them all!

summary: you keep posting about these characters like Kiri and the tiny badaged goblin. Is this like a video series, and, if so, what is...
question: you keep posting about these characters like Kiri and the tiny badaged goblin. Is this like a video series, and, if so, what is it?
answer: They’re characters from a web series called Critical Role where a cast of nerdy voice actors play dungeons and dragons. They finished their first campaign and currently in their second.  It’s a great series to get into. You can find episodes on YouTube.

reblog.comment: They’re characters from a web series called Critical Role where a cast of nerdy voice actors play dungeons and dragons. They finished their first campaign and currently in their second.  It’s a great series to get into. You can find episodes on YouTube.

hey y'all, it’s the first day of new crit role that i’ve had this sideblog, so have a little warning:

• this blog won’t be spoiler free

• all spoilers WILL be tagged “cr spoilers”

• i may do some light liveblogging? and that’ll be tagged as above, and also as “cr liveblog”

summary: You know, i was rereading traveling hearts, and i noticed something i didnt quite catch the first time; a line of dialogue...
question: You know, i was rereading traveling hearts, and i noticed something i didnt quite catch the first time; a line of dialogue indiciates that caleb has permanently dismissed a firmiliar before, and i was just wondering if you'd be willing to expand on that? Is it connected to trent?
answer:
I figure it’s connected to Trent, yeah. I’ve seen a few other people with this headcanon before, especially now that we know Caleb didn’t actually “get” Frumpkin until he escaped the asylum. Which seems weird considering that Find Familiar is a first level spell, so him, Astrid, and Eodwulf would probably have learned it at the academy even before catching Trent’s eye.

I sort of look at a wizard’s familiar the same way I look at daemons from His Dark Materials - while they are independent beings, they’re also linked to you in such a way as to be basically a part of you, an external piece of your soul, and so you’re stronger emotionally for having them. Hell, in old versions of DND, I think the death of a familiar caused psychic damage.

I sort of explored that idea in “More Than This”, where having Frumpkin meant that Caleb wasn’t entirely gone inside his own head, he could function a little better than he might otherwise, because Frumpkin was able to guide and reassure him on a level that the others just couldn’t reach. I mean, hell, Frumpkin genuinely had a higher INT score than Caleb did at the time.

Trent being the utter abusive monster that he is, I agree with others who’ve said that he probably insisted the Blumenthal Three permanently dismiss their familiars before they started training with him, as some demonstration of utter loyalty to the empire or proof of self-reliance or some nonsense like that. That probably caused them all some genuine mental trauma that he was then able to exploit in turning them into his executioners.
